intro: Habranthus bagnoldii var. gilliesianus, commonly known as the Gillies' grass of Eden, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tufted, grass-like foliage and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to bloom in late spring. This variety is noted for its resilience and adaptability to arid conditions.
